book.name: Latest News
book.intro: Learn how to use the Latest News to communicate with students.

chapter.title: Latest News
chapter.content:
Latest News

Latest News is a special form of a forum. Think of it as an easy way to make announcements. Only the Feasibility Teacher can post to this forum. Students are limited to reading the posts and can NOT respond. 

Latest News should be found in two places- the very first section of the course and in a block to the right. The block to the right will display the latest five announcements. 

This is a great way to remind students of upcoming assignments, provide them with tips and tricks, or motivational ideas.

chapter.title: Adding an announcement
chapter.content:
Adding an announcement

There are two ways to add an announcement. 

  1. Click on the "Add a new topic..." link in the Latest News block
  2. Click on Latest News in the top general section, then click the "Add a new topic" button. 
     -> 

Either of these methods will take you to the same place. 

Enter your Subject (Title) and then a message. (You can add an attachment too, if needed). The subject is what the students will actually see without clicking on anything. The more descriptive the better. 

Scroll to the bottom and click "Post to forum". 

*Note that everyone is subscribed to this forum. However, students may not have legitimate email addresses. They will see the Announcements in the Latest News block.

chapter.title: Viewing Announcements
chapter.content:
Viewing Announcements

The Latest News block will be set to show the previous five posts. This means that students will see the titles of the last five announcements that have been published. When they click on the Title (Subject when composing the announcement), they can see the entire message. 

Thus, in the example above, the subject of the latest announcement was "Added the news forum back into courses". Clicking on that title will take the students to read the actual message. 

Also note that students can easily get to all of the messages by clicking on the "Older topics..." link.
